title: ICE: trust-dns-proto

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### It broke when I updated nightly I think this crate was a dependency of one of my dependencies. I don't directly use it at all. The crate is `trust-dns-proto` and I have no idea what it does. It broke just today as I updated the nightly compiler. It worked in nightly 1eaadebb3 2020-10-21. ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.49.0-nightly (4f7612ac1 2020-10-31) binary: rustc commit-hash: 4f7612ac1499258025077f1fd05d2f429f9accfb commit-date: 2020-10-31 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.49.0-nightly ``` ### Error output ``` Compiling trust-dns-proto v0.19.5 error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_mir_build/src/thir/pattern/_match.rs:931:18: trying to compare incompatible constructors Single and Str(Const { ty: &str, val: Value(Slice { data: Allocation { bytes: [105, 115, 115, 117, 101], relocations: Relocations(SortedMap { data: [] }), init_mask: InitMask { blocks: [31], len: Size { raw: 5 } }, size: Size { raw: 5 }, align: Align { pow2: 0 }, mutability: Not, extra: () }, start: 0, end: 5 }) }) thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:942:9 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.49.0-nightly (4f7612ac1 2020-10-31) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 --crate-type lib note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [check_match] match-checking `>::from` #1 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack error: aborting due to previous error error: could not compile `trust-dns-proto` To learn more, run the command again with --verbose. ```
RUST_BACKTRACE=1

``` error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_mir_build/src/thir/pattern/_match.rs:931:18: trying to compare incompatible constructors Single and Str(Const { ty: &str, val: Value(Slice { data: Allocation { bytes: [105, 115, 115, 117, 101], relocations: Relocations(SortedMap { data: [] }), init_mask: InitMask { blocks: [31], len: Size { raw: 5 } }, size: Size { raw: 5 }, align: Align { pow2: 0 }, mutability: Not, extra: () }, start: 0, end: 5 }) }) thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:942:9 stack backtrace: 0: std::panicking::begin_panic 1: rustc_errors::HandlerInner::bug 2: rustc_errors::Handler::bug 3: rustc_middle::util::bug::opt_span_bug_fmt::{{closure}} 4: rustc_middle::ty::context::tls::with_opt::{{closure}} 5: rustc_middle::ty::context::tls::with_opt 6: rustc_middle::util::bug::opt_span_bug_fmt 7: rustc_middle::util::bug::bug_fmt 8: rustc_mir_build::thir::pattern::_match::Matrix::specialize_constructor 9: as core::iter::traits::iterator::Iterator>::try_fold 10: rustc_mir_build::thir::pattern::_match::is_useful 11: ::visit_expr 12: rustc_hir::intravisit::walk_expr 13: ::visit_expr 14: rustc_mir_build::thir::pattern::check_match::check_match 15: rustc_middle::ty::query:: for rustc_middle::ty::query::queries::check_match>::compute 16: rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::with_task_impl 17: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack 18: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query_impl 19: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::ensure_query_impl 20: rustc_interface::passes::analysis 21: rustc_middle::ty::query:: for rustc_middle::ty::query::queries::analysis>::compute 22: rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::with_task_impl 23: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack 24: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query_impl 25: rustc_interface::passes::QueryContext::enter 26: rustc_interface::queries::::enter 27: rustc_span::with_source_map 28: scoped_tls::ScopedKey::set note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.49.0-nightly (4f7612ac1 2020-10-31) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 --crate-type lib note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [check_match] match-checking `>::from` #1 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack error: aborting due to previous error ```
